text:
Question 58) The cleaning capacity and efficiency of a soap depends on their property of stable micelles, which easily drag the molecules impregnated with the material to be cleaned. Such micelles have parts capable of interacting with polar substances, such as water, and parts that can interact with nonpolar substances such as fats and oils.
SANTOS, W. L. P.; MOL, G. S. (coords.). Chemistry and society. The substance capable of forming the structures mentioned is
A) C18h36.
B) C17H33Cona.
C) CH3CH2Coon.
D) CH3CH2CH2COOH.
E) CH3CH2CH2CH2OCH2CH2CH2CH3.
